title: Realme 16 Pro, Pad 3 and Buds Air8 make their debut today
description: Realme’s 16 Pro series was officially introduced in India today, marking the first major launch event for the brand in 2026. Alongside the 16 Pro+, Realme also introduced the regular 16 Pro as well as its Pad 3 tablet and Buds Air8 wireless earbuds. Realme 16 Pro Realme 16 Pro shares some of its key specs with the 16 Pro+, including the 200MP main camera (Samsung HP5), complete with Realme’s LumaColor Image processing technology. The device also features an 8MP ultrawide lens, but does not have a dedicated telephoto lens like the 16 Pro+. Realme 16 Pro Realme 16 Pro...

title: Redmi Note 15 5G and Redmi Pad 2 Pro now available in India
description: After making its global debut in December 2025, the Redmi Note 15 5G has now made its way to India. It is available for purchase in the country alongside the Redmi Pad 2 Pro. In India, the Redmi Note 15 5G will go on sale starting January 9. It will be sold in Black, Mist Purple, and Glacier Blue color options. The phone is priced at INR 22,999 for the 8GB/128GB model and INR 24,999 for the 8GB/256GB option. Meanwhile, the Redmi Pad 2 Pro will be available for purchase starting January 12. The tablet is being offered in Graphite Grey and Quick Silver colors. It carries a price tag...

title: Samsung showcases foldable display with no visible crease at CES 2026
description: With CES 2026 underway, brands are unveiling their latest tech. Samsung has announced several products, including a massive 130-inch Micro RGB TV. It reportedly also showcased a new creaseless foldable display at the event. Tipster Ice Universe has shared images of a new foldable display that was showcased by Samsung Display at CES. The display is expected to be used in Apple’s iPhone Fold. According to the tipster, the panel shows no visible crease, which is a common drawback of current foldable screens. Samsung appears to have significantly minimized the crease with this new...

title: vivo Y50s 5G and Y50e 5G go official with 6,000mAh batteries, Dimensity 6300 SoC
description: vivo has launched two new affordable 5G phones in China, namely the Y50s 5G and the Y50e 5G. Both models feature an identical design and share most of their specifications. The phones are now available for purchase in the Chinese market. The vivo Y50s 5G and Y50e 5G are powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 6300 SoC. At the front, the handsets sport a 6.74-inch flat LCD panel with a refresh rate of 90Hz, HD+ resolution, and 1,000 nit peak brightness. At the back, both phones come with a single 13MP camera, which is paired with an infrared sensor and LED flash. There’s also a breathing...

title: Realme 16 Pro+ in for review
description: Realme kicks off 2026 in style with the 16 Pro+. The phone has a solid specs sheet, but what you'll notice first is just how impressive it looks. But before we get to either topic, let's unbox it. The phone ships with a full box - you get a USB-A to USB-C cable, a case, and an 80W SuperVOOC charger. Unboxing the Realme 16 Pro+ The Realme 16 Pro+ will come in a few finishes - Master Grey, Camellia Pink, and the Master Gold unit we've got in the office. It has a bio-based organic silicone back panel, which has what Realme calls a wheat-grain texture. It looks and feels very much...

title: Here's when the vivo X200T is expected to launch and how much it will cost
description: According to a new rumor, vivo will be launching the X200T in India in the last week of this month. The phone will have "aggressive pricing", starting around INR 50,000 to INR 55,000. That's lower than what a previous rumor claimed - INR 60,000. The vivo X200T will allegedly be offered in Stellar Black and Seaside Lilac. Its design will be very closely mimicking that of the X200 FE, but it will come with the "high-octane performance DNA of the standard X200", the source of this rumor says. vivo X200 FE The X200T reportedly has a 6.67-inch AMOLED screen with 120Hz refresh rate, a...

title: Realme 16 Pro+ is here with 200MP main cam and 7,000 mAh battery
description: Realme 16 Pro+ is the first major release from the brand in 2026, and it brings an updated design with a clear focus on cameras. It's among the first Realme devices to sport the new LumaColor Image image processing technology, which aims to deliver more natural skin tones, improved color accuracy and real-world lighting. Realme 16 Pro+ features a 200MP main camera with a Samsung HP5 (1/1.56-inch type) sensor and an f/1.8 aperture. The main shooter supports full-pixel auto zoom with 1x and 2x lossless zoom. Thanks to the LumaColor Image system, Realme 16 Pro+ features 21 exclusive...

title: RedMagic 11 Air seemingly runs Geekbench confirming its chipset and RAM amount
description: Last month RedMagic confirmed that it's working on the 11 Air, the successor to the RedMagic 10 Air launched back in April. The RedMagic 11 Air uses the Snapdragon 8 Elite SoC, as confirmed by a Geekbench run of a device with the model number NX799J. This is most likely the RedMagic 11 Air. The prototype which ran the benchmark has 16GB of RAM, but of course more memory options could be offered upon launch (in fact, up to 24GB was rumored). The phone will run Android 16 from day one, unsurprisingly. As you can see, the RedMagic 11 Air managed a single-core score of 3,075 and a...

title: Qualcomm announces Snapdragon X2 Plus for cheaper laptops
description: Back in September, Qualcomm unveiled the Snapdragon X2 Elite and Snapdragon X2 Elite Extreme chipsets for Windows on Arm laptops, and today it's introducing the cheaper option in the portfolio, the Snapdragon X2 Plus. This is the successor to the Snapdragon X Plus from September 2024. The Snapdragon X2 Plus uses the third generation Oryon CPU and it has an 80 TOPS NPU. It's made on a 3nm process. It comes in two versions - 10-core and 6-core. The 10-core version has 34MB of total cache, and a maximum multithread frequency of 4GHz. The 6-core version obviously has six CPU cores, with 22MB...

title: Gemini on Google TV is getting smarter
description: Today at CES, Google has announced a few improvements coming to Gemini for Google TV. These features will arrive on "select TCL devices" first, and other Google TV devices "over the coming months". First, you'll be able to use Gemini to search through your Google Photos library for specific people or moments, and instantly apply artistic styles with Photos Remix or make immersive cinematic slideshows. Gemini's responses will adapt to your queries with imagery, videos, and real-time sports updates, while for complex topics "Deep dives" will give you narrated, interactive overviews...

title: Amazon's Alexa+ now has a home on the web
description: Amazon's AI-powered Alexa+ chatbot now has its very own home on the web at alexa.com. You just need to sign in with your Amazon account to use it, provided you are part of the Alexa+ Early Access. Amazon says over 10 million people are already using Alexa+, the AI-infused evolution of the Alexa assistant. These people are apparently having three times more conversations with Alexa+ than they did with the original Alexa. 97% of Amazon's devices that support Alexa now have Alexa+. On the web, you can use Alexa+ just as you use Gemini or ChatGPT, which of course leads to the obvious...

title: Motorola Razr Fold leaks in official-looking images in two colors
description: Mere hours ago we got word that Motorola is working on its first book-style foldable to be called Razr Fold, and now some official-looking press renders showing it have been leaked by Evan Blass, the legend also known as @evleaks. Motorola Razr Fold leaked images As you can see from the images above and below, it borrows the design language from the upcoming Signature, but adds a hinge of course. And a foldable screen. And a cover display. And it will also have stylus support, just like the Signature, Motorola's upcoming mainstream flagship smartphone. Motorola Razr...

title: MediaTek is unveiling two new chipsets on January 15, Dimensity 8500 is one of them
description: MediaTek is holding a launch event in China on January 15, and is expected to unveil two new chipsets on that occasion. Rumor has it will we finally see the much-anticipated Dimensity 8500 at this event, the successor to the 8450 and 8400, both highly regarded upper-midrange chipsets. The Honor Power2, which was unveiled earlier today, uses the Dimensity 8500 so the official announcement of the chip is more of a formality at this point. The other SoC that's due to be unveiled next week is more of a mystery, with rumors in China talking about a new 9-series chip, perhaps called...

title: The Pro cameraphone comparison: Honor vs Oppo vs Vivo
Report: Samsung to raise Galaxy S26 prices in Korea, may keep them the same in the US
description: Korean publication FN News has some good news and some bad news for people wanting to buy the Galaxy S26 when it comes out (likely in March) – prices are going up, but launch day deals may allow you to dodge the price hike. According to industry sources, the prices of the base 256GB models will increase between KRW 44,000 and KRW 88,000 in South Korea. For reference, the Galaxy S25 launched at KRW 1,155,000, the S25+ at KRW 1,353,000 and the S25 Ultra at KRW 1,698,400. That’s for Korea – Samsung will reportedly keep the launch prices the same for select overseas markets like the US....

title: OnePlus Turbo 6V pops up on TENAA
description: Chinese regulatory TENAA published a listing for an upcoming OnePlus phone and judging by the images, it's safe to assume that it's the Turbo 6V phone that the company teased last month alongside the vanilla Turbo 6. OnePlus Turbo 6V The TENAA listing reveals a 6.78-inch OLED panel with a 144Hz refresh rate, while the chipset is likely the Snapdragon 7s Gen 4. The available RAM options will be 8GB, 12GB and 16GB, while storage variants are 128GB, 256GB and 512GB. The back has a 50 MP main camera paired with a 2 MP shooter, which is either used for macro or depth sensing. The...

title: TSMC’s 2nm chips will be significantly more expensive than previous generations
description: While Samsung already announced the world’s first 2nm chip with its Exynos 2600, which will make its debut on the Galaxy S26 series, key competitors like Apple, Qualcomm and MediaTek are also expected to bring their own 2nm chips in the coming months. The Apple A20 chip, set to power the iPhone 18 series, alongside the Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 6 and Dimensity 9600, which will be at the helm of this year’s Android flagships are all expected to be fabbed on TSMC’s N2 process node, which has now entered mass production capacity. A new report from Taiwan’s Economic Daily News suggests that...

title: Motorola's book-style foldable is coming, to be called Razr Fold
description: According to a leaked Lenovo presentation, Motorola is developing its first book-style foldable smartphone, reportedly called the Razr Fold. The device is expected to launch later this year. Prominent leaker Evan Blass shared slides from the internal presentation, which outline several upcoming Lenovo and Motorola products. One of the slides confirms the existence of the Motorola Razr Fold. While the slide mentions a launch window later this year, it does not reveal an exact date. That said, there’s a chance Motorola could unveil the Razr Fold at CES 2026. The leaked slide also...

title: TCL NxtPaper 70 Pro announced with NxtPaper 4.0 screen, Dimensity 7300 SoC
description: TCL has unveiled the NxtPaper 70 Pro at CES 2026. It features a NxtPaper key that lets users switch between various screen modes with ease, and features a NxtPaper 4.0 display. The NxtPaper 70 Pro sports a 6.9-inch NxtPaper 4.0 display that has a refresh rate of 120Hz, Full-HD+ resolution, and a brightness of 900 nits. The panel offers seven eye-care technologies that include a natural light mode, zero flicker, blue light purification, anti-glare viewing, and more. Another highlight of the phone is the dedicated NxtPaper key, which lets users switch between Color Paper, Ink Paper,...

title: Here's when the iQOO 15 Ultra is officially launching
description: The iQOO 15 launched in China in October and elsewhere in November, and we recently heard that it will soon be joined by the iQOO 15 Ultra, which, according to the latest rumor on the matter, will boast the biggest active cooling fan ever seen in a smartphone. Today the prolific Chinese leaker who goes by Digital Chat Station on Weibo has shared when we should expect the iQOO 15 Ultra to be launching - in early February. That aligns with earlier rumors which simply stated it would arrive before the Chinese New Year, which is on February 17. And the brand itself has just confirmed...
